intro: Sphedamnocarpus madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
